Off the Beaten Path

El Cuyo

entry.title: Destination of the Month
entry.content:
Destination of the Month

Kowloon

One of the most densely populated cities on Earth, Hong Kong's mainland portion offers a culture less influenced by the British than the neighboring Island, plus accommodation, dining, and nightlife are generally cheaper.

entry.title: having large buttocks
entry.content: ... that having large buttocks can be a tactical advantage in hockey?

entry.title: Edward Lloyd
entry.content: ... that Edward Lloyd was the namesake of Lloyd's of London but not its founder?

entry.title: Shiver
entry.content: ... that Nintendo denied that Shiver from Splatoon 3 is non-binary?

entry.title: a member of one of the best-selling boy bands of all time
entry.content: ... that a member of one of the best-selling boy bands of all time was also signed to the football club Doncaster Rovers?

entry.title: a mountain in Southern California
entry.content: ... that a mountain in Southern California was used by the Marquardt Corporation as a laboratory to test "highly reactive or toxic" rocket propellant?

entry.title: Lotte Ledl
entry.content: ... that Lotte Ledl, who played characters at the Vienna Burgtheater, in Heimatfilme, in literature adaptations and in crime series, was awarded an honorific title at the age of 89?

entry.title: Longfellow Boom
entry.content: ... that the mysterious Longfellow Boom has been attributed to rail cars coupling, secret NORAD flights, an underground meth lab, or a fault line in the Mississippi River?

entry.title: Hanoikids
entry.content: ... that Hanoikids gave free tours of Hanoi to a prime minister of Australia, an American general, and an American senator?

entry.title: Laura Kenny
entry.content: ... that Laura Kenny (pictured) is the most decorated British female athlete in Olympic history?
